trans-unit.source: Diamond 4Cs Education – Diamond Clarity

seg-source.mrk: Diamond 4Cs Education – Diamond Clarity

target.mrk: Diamond 4Cs Education – Diamond Clarity

trans-unit.source: Diamond Clarity Refers to the Absence of Inclusions and Blemishes

seg-source.mrk: Diamond Clarity Refers to the Absence of Inclusions and Blemishes

target.mrk: Diamond Clarity Refers to the Absence of Inclusions and Blemishes

trans-unit.source: Natural diamonds are the result of carbon exposed to tremendous heat and pressure deep in the earth. This process can result in a variety of internal characteristics called '<hyperlink1>inclusions</hyperlink1>' and external characteristics called '<hyperlink2>blemishes</hyperlink2>.'

seg-source.mrk: Natural diamonds are the result of carbon exposed to tremendous heat and pressure deep in the earth.
This process can result in a variety of internal characteristics called '<hyperlink1>inclusions</hyperlink1>' and external characteristics called '<hyperlink2>blemishes</hyperlink2>.'

target.mrk: Natural diamonds are the result of carbon exposed to tremendous heat and pressure deep in the earth.
This process can result in a variety of internal characteristics called '<hyperlink1>inclusions</hyperlink1>' and external characteristics called '<hyperlink2>blemishes</hyperlink2>.'

trans-unit.source: Evaluating diamond clarity involves determining the number, size, relief, nature, and position of these characteristics, as well as how these affect the overall appearance of the stone. While no diamond is perfectly pure, the closer it comes, the higher its value.

seg-source.mrk: Evaluating diamond clarity involves determining the number, size, relief, nature, and position of these characteristics, as well as how these affect the overall appearance of the stone.
While no diamond is perfectly pure, the closer it comes, the higher its value.

target.mrk: Evaluating diamond clarity involves determining the number, size, relief, nature, and position of these characteristics, as well as how these affect the overall appearance of the stone.
While no diamond is perfectly pure, the closer it comes, the higher its value.

trans-unit.source: <hyperlink1>The GIA Diamond Clarity Scale</hyperlink1> has 6 categories, some of which are divided, for a total of 11 specific grades.

seg-source.mrk: <hyperlink1>The GIA Diamond Clarity Scale</hyperlink1> has 6 categories, some of which are divided, for a total of 11 specific grades.

target.mrk: <hyperlink1>The GIA Diamond Clarity Scale</hyperlink1> has 6 categories, some of which are divided, for a total of 11 specific grades.

trans-unit.source: <run1>Flawless (FL)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions and no blemishes visible under <hyperlink3>10x magnification<run4/></hyperlink3>

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Flawless (FL)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions and no blemishes visible under <hyperlink3>10x magnification<run4/></hyperlink3>

target.mrk: <run1>Flawless (FL)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions and no blemishes visible under <hyperlink3>10x magnification<run4/></hyperlink3>

trans-unit.source: Rectangle 3

seg-source.mrk: Rectangle 3

target.mrk: Rectangle 3

trans-unit.source: <run1>Internally Flawless (IF)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions visible under 10x magnification

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Internally Flawless (IF)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions visible under 10x magnification

target.mrk: <run1>Internally Flawless (IF)</run1><tags2/>No inclusions visible under 10x magnification

trans-unit.source: <run1>Very, Very Slightly Included (VVS<run2>1</run2> and VVS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions so slight they are difficult for a skilled grader to see under 10x magnification

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Very, Very Slightly Included (VVS<run2>1</run2> and VVS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions so slight they are difficult for a skilled grader to see under 10x magnification

target.mrk: <run1>Very, Very Slightly Included (VVS<run2>1</run2> and VVS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions so slight they are difficult for a skilled grader to see under 10x magnification

trans-unit.source: <run1>Very Slightly Included (VS<run2>1</run2> and VS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are observed with effort under 10x magnification, but can be characterized as minor

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Very Slightly Included (VS<run2>1</run2> and VS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are observed with effort under 10x magnification, but can be characterized as minor

target.mrk: <run1>Very Slightly Included (VS<run2>1</run2> and VS<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are observed with effort under 10x magnification, but can be characterized as minor

trans-unit.source: <run1>Slightly Included (SI<run2>1</run2> and SI<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are noticeable under 10x magnification

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Slightly Included (SI<run2>1</run2> and SI<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are noticeable under 10x magnification

target.mrk: <run1>Slightly Included (SI<run2>1</run2> and SI<run3>2</run3>)</run1><tags4/>Inclusions are noticeable under 10x magnification

trans-unit.source: <run1>Included (I<run2>1</run2>, I<run3>2</run3>, and I<run4>3</run4>)</run1><tags5/>Inclusions are obvious under 10x magnification which may affect transparency and brilliance

seg-source.mrk: <run1>Included (I<run2>1</run2>, I<run3>2</run3>, and I<run4>3</run4>)</run1><tags5/>Inclusions are obvious under 10x magnification which may affect transparency and brilliance

target.mrk: <run1>Included (I<run2>1</run2>, I<run3>2</run3>, and I<run4>3</run4>)</run1><tags5/>Inclusions are obvious under 10x magnification which may affect transparency and brilliance

trans-unit.source: Many inclusions and blemishes are too tiny to be seen by anyone other than a trained diamond grader. To the naked eye, a VS<run1>1</run1> and an SI<run2>2</run2> diamond may look exactly the same, but these diamonds are quite different in terms of overall quality. This is why expert and accurate assessment of diamond clarity is extremely important.

seg-source.mrk: Many inclusions and blemishes are too tiny to be seen by anyone other than a trained diamond grader.
To the naked eye, a VS<run1>1</run1> and an SI<run2>2</run2> diamond may look exactly the same, but these diamonds are quite different in terms of overall quality.
This is why expert and accurate assessment of diamond clarity is extremely important.

target.mrk: Many inclusions and blemishes are too tiny to be seen by anyone other than a trained diamond grader.
To the naked eye, a VS<run1>1</run1> and an SI<run2>2</run2> diamond may look exactly the same, but these diamonds are quite different in terms of overall quality.
This is why expert and accurate assessment of diamond clarity is extremely important.

trans-unit.source: How did the GIA Clarity Scale come to be?<tags1/>Like the color scale, GIA's clarity grading system developed because jewelers were using terms that could be misinterpreted, <run2>"loupe clean" or "piqué™." </run2>Today, even if you buy a diamond somewhere else in the world, the jeweler will most likely use terms like VVS<run3>1</run3> or SI<run4>2</run4>, even if his or her language is French or Japanese instead of English.

seg-source.mrk: How did the GIA Clarity Scale come to be?<tags1/>Like the color scale, GIA's clarity grading system developed because jewelers were using terms that could be misinterpreted, <run2>"loupe clean" or "piqué™." </run2>Today, even if you buy a diamond somewhere else in the world, the jeweler will most likely use terms like VVS<run3>1</run3> or SI<run4>2</run4>, even if his or her language is French or Japanese instead of English.

target.mrk: How did the GIA Clarity Scale come to be?<tags1/>Like the color scale, GIA's clarity grading system developed because jewelers were using terms that could be misinterpreted, <run2>"loupe clean" or "piqué™." </run2>Today, even if you buy a diamond somewhere else in the world, the jeweler will most likely use terms like VVS<run3>1</run3> or SI<run4>2</run4>, even if his or her language is French or Japanese instead of English.

trans-unit.source: What causes inclusions?<tags1/>Small crystals can become trapped in a diamond when it's forming. Sometimes as a crystal grows it can develop irregularities in its atomic structure.

seg-source.mrk: What causes inclusions?<tags1/>Small crystals can become trapped in a diamond when it's forming.
Sometimes as a crystal grows it can develop irregularities in its atomic structure.

target.mrk: What causes inclusions?<tags1/>Small crystals can become trapped in a diamond when it's forming.
Sometimes as a crystal grows it can develop irregularities in its atomic structure.
